chapterTitle: Financial Statements, Taxes, and Cash Flow

columns.text: In this problem, we are asked to determine the net income of Griffin's Goat Farm, Inc.

First, before we proceed with the computation, let us understand what net income is.

**Net income** is the business income after subtracting all of its expenses for the period.

To calculate the net income of the company, we must first build an income statement from the following provided details:

| $\hspace{.10cm}$  Particulars      | Amount ($)  |
|------------------|----------:|
| Sales           | 796,000 |
| Cost             | 327,000 |
| Depreciation     | 42,000  |
| Interest expense$\hspace{.80cm}$   | 34,000  |

**Income statement** is a statement of financial results from operations that displays the sales and expenses for a particular period. In preparing an income statement, it is essential to take note of its equation:

$$\text{Sales}-\text{Expenses}=\text{Net income}$$

The income statement presentsÂ different stages such as gross profit, earnings before taxes, taxable income, and, finally, net income.

As presented below, after deducting all the expenses which comprise the cost of sales, depreciation, and interest expense, we have determined that the company has a taxable income of $393,000.

$$\def\arraystretch{1.2}
\begin{array}{|c|}
\hline
\textbf{Griffin's Goat Farm, Inc.}\\
\text{Income Statement Before Tax}\\
\text{For the year ended December 31, 20XX}\\
\hline
\begin{array}{l r r }\\
\text{Sales} & \$796,000 &\\
\text{Less: Cost of Sales} & \underline{327,000} & \\
\textbf{Gross Profit} &  \$469,000\\
\text{Less: Depreciation} & \underline{\quad42,000} &\\
\textbf{Earnings before interest and taxes} & \$427,000\\
\text{Interest Expense} & \underline{34,000}\\
\textbf{Taxable income}  & \underline{\underline{\mathbf{\$393,000}}}\\

\end{array}\\\\
\hline
\end{array}$$

For the next step, the problem mentioned the tax rate at 21%. The tax rate is used to determine the income tax expense the business owes to the government. Income tax expense is calculated with the following formula:

$$\text{Income tax expense}=\text{Taxable income}\times\text{Tax rate}$$

**As presented below, after deducting the income tax expense to the taxable income, we can see that Griffin's Goat Farm, Inc. has a total net income of $310,470.**

$$\def\arraystretch{1.2}
\begin{array}{|c|}
\hline
\textbf{Griffin's Goat Farm, Inc.}\\
\text{Income Statement}\\
\text{For the year ended December 31, 20XX}\\
\hline
\begin{array}{l r r }\\
\text{Sales} & \$796,000 &\\
\text{Less: Cost of Goods Sold} & \underline{327,000} & \\
\textbf{Gross Profit} & \$469,000\\
\text{Less: Depreciation} & \underline{\quad42,000} &\\
\textbf{Earnings before interest and taxes} & \$427,000\\
\text{Less: Interest Expense} & \underline{34,000}\\
\textbf{Taxable income} & \$393,000\\
\text{Less: Income Tax Expense} & \underline{82,530}\\
\textbf{Net Income} & \underline{\underline{\mathbf{\$310,470}}}\\
\end{array}\\\\
\hline
\end{array}$$


In summary, we have determined the total net income of Griffin's Goat Farm, Inc. by building the company's income statement, which can be formed by subtracting all the expenses company, including the income tax expense.
